Enjoy the latest episodes from MacStories’ family of podcasts:

This week, Federico and I consider the differences between assistive and generative AI and cover the sort of automation tasks for which assistive AI is useful.

On AppStories+, I share my skepticism about the utility of Apple’s rumored home hub device.

NPC: Next Portable Console

Tencent and Intel announce a huge handheld, Sony is taking its time, reviewers share early hands-on testing of the Ayn Odin Portal, the Miyoo Mini Flip is spotted across the Internet, Samsung files an intriguing portable gaming patent, and a new eGPU is on the way. Plus, Brendon revisits the Anbernic RG35XXSP, Federico has a mini-surprise, and Federico and I share oue first impressions of the Retroid Pocket 5.

Links and Show Notes

AppStories+ Pre-Show

Visit AppStories.net to learn more about the extended, high bitrate audio version of AppStories that is delivered early each week and subscribe.

  • Apple’s Rumored Home Hub

    • Apple’s first smart display needs to make the smart home just work

Main Show - Assistive Versus Generative AI

  • Context, Consent, and Control: The Three C’s of Data Participation in the Age of AI
  • What Is Agentic AI?
  • AI Companies Need to Be Regulated: An Open Letter to the U.S. Congress and European Parliament
  • Apple’s Commitment to AI Is Clear, But Its Execution Is Uneven
  • Apple Frames 3.3 Adds Support for iPhone 16 and 16 Pro, M4 iPad Pro, and Apple Watch Series 10 (feat. An Unexpected Technical Detour)
  • ChatGPT’s Last Mile Solution for Apple Frames: ImageMagick

On AppStories+, a video experiment, I have iPad Pro follow-up, and Federico has technical follow-up and a question for listeners about streaming videogames over Wi-Fi.
